interestingFact: Japan is made up of over 6,800 islands, and it has more vending machines than any other country in the world.
Canada has the longest coastline in the world, stretching over 202,080 kilometers.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world’s oxygen.
Australia is the only continent without an active volcano.
The Great Pyramid of Giza, located in Egypt, is the last of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World still standing.
Iceland is one of the most eco-friendly countries in the world and runs almost entirely on renewable energy.
India is home to the world’s largest democracy and the iconic Taj Mahal, a UNESCO World Heritage site.
Norway is known for its spectacular fjords and is one of the happiest countries in the world according to the World Happiness Report.
Italy has more UNESCO World Heritage Sites than any other country, with a total of 58 sites.
South Africa is the only country in the world with three capital cities.
